question: What is a continental shelf?
option1: It is a part of the ocean which is really an extension of the land mass, but submerged
option2: It is that part where the ocean commences
option3: It is a land mass which is surrounded by water on all sides
option4: It is a part of the continent that is submerged in relatively shallow sea
answer: It is a part of the ocean which is really an extension of the land mass, but submerged
explanation: A continental shelf is the edge of a continent lying beneath the ocean. This shelf extends from the coastline of a continent to a drop off point called the shelf break. The shelf break is where the underwater edge of a continent shelf begins to rapidly slope downwards towards the ocean floor depths.
